title: BRITAX G3 Convertible Car Seats: Rear Facing Installation using the Lap Belt Only
description: Installing BRITAX MARATHON 70-G3, BOULEVARD 70-G3, PAVILION 70-G3, and ADVOCATE 70-G3 Convertible Car Seats rear facing using the vehicle lap belt. **Refer to your user guide for complete installation instructions.

asset.author: Britax Child Safety, Inc
asset.hookText: Installing BRITAX MARATHON 70-G3, BOULEVARD 70-G3, PAVILION 70-G3, and ADVOCATE 70-G3 Convertible Car Seats rear facing using the vehicle lap belt. **Refer to your user guide for complete installation instructions.

transcripts: Fully reclining the child seat and place it rear facing on the vehicle seat. Loosen the harness by lifting the harness adjuster lever and pulling both harness straps forward from the chest clip and remove the body pillow if in place on buckle the harness. Pull the seat portion of the cover forward to access the rear facing belt path. Route the vehicle belt through the rear facing belts slats ensuring the vehicle belt is routed under the harness buckle strap. Ensure the vehicle belt is not twisted then buckle. Push down on the middle of the child seat while pulling the vehicle belt to remove all slack. Check to make sure the installation is secure. The child seat should not move more than one inch side to side or front to back at the belt path. If the child seat is not secure. Repeat the installation process or use a different seating location. When properly installed in the rear facing position the back of the child seat should be at least 30 degrees for children in up to 45 degrees from vertical for infants unable to maintain had no control when the car is parked on a level surface. Use the blue line as a guide to achieve the proper recline angle for rear facing installations. The blue line will be parallel to the ground when the child seat angle is at the center of the angle range 30 to 45 degrees. If necessary the proper reclining angle can be achieved by placing a pool noodle a rolled towel in the vehicle seat bite and reinstalling the child seat rear facing installations can be improved by the use of the versa tether. Please review the versa t'other section of the demonstration videos on our website for further instruction.
